name: 5-tert-butyl-2-methyl-3-furoic acid
Reason: 5-tert-butyl-2-methyl-3-furoic acid has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components: (1) The basic unit for comparison is furan, which has a melting point of -10.5°C. The tert-butyl group (C(C)C) adds rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at around +10°C. The methyl group (C) introduces a bulky side chain, reducing the crystal lattice symmetry, which might lower the melting point by approximately -10°C. The carbonyl group (C(=O)) raises the melting point due to hydrogen bonding and dipole-dipole interactions, estimated at around +10°C. The furoic acid moiety (Cc1c(cc(o1)C(C)(C)C)C(=O)O) introduces a rigid structure with potential hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +20°C.
